instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NOT CHARGING
threads.message:
hello got this model green light only cant on with charger alone
but when i put new battery can on it shows battery is charging but only green light.
ppbus 5v only battery not connected. with battery 11v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin 17-18/27-28 ohms is normal
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
1 - 0v
2- 16v
3 - 4v
9 - 0v
12 - 3.4v
13 - 3.4v
14 - 3.3v
15 - 0v
17 - looping 4.2v-4.5v
19 - 5.v
20 - 5.v
25 - looping 4.2v-4.5v
27 - 16v
j7950 voltage also normal.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NOT CHARGING
threads.message:
Check R7C7025 first.
Be sure to have good solders and traces around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Post voltage of its pin 6.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NOT CHARGING
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NOT CHARGING
threads.message:
Check the components and traces from pins 5/7/8 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Did you try another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
